course.subject: RMBI
course.name: Quantitative Methods for Risk Management
course.description: The course covers statistical analysis, simulation and optimization methods that are commonly used in management of both market and credit risk. Risk factors and loss distribution. Losses over several periods and scaling. Coherent measures of risk. Capital allocation. Extreme value analysis. Importance sampling. Simulation techniques, including random number generations, variance reduction methods and statistical analysis of simulation outputs. Bernoulli mixture models. Financial and actuarial pricing of credit risk. Case studies of major credit losses.
course.prerequisites: ISOM 3540 OR MATH 2421 OR MATH 2431

Poorly organized.


Course Content
1. Financial risks: Loss distribution and risk measures
1.1 Wall Street fails Main street
 Systemic risk
 Black Monday in 1987: market failure arising from program trading
 Long Term Capital Management: failure of convergence arbitrage
 Barings Bank failure: loss of risk control
 Model risk: Constant Proportional Debts Obligations
 Legal risk: Lehman Brothers’ mini bonds
1.2 Hedging of market risks
 Dynamic hedging of options
 Minimum variance hedge ratio
 Duration measure and bond immunization
1.3 Portfolio loss distribution
 Credit risk: Loan portfolio losses
 Fitting of loss distribution
1.4 VaR (Value at Risk) and Expected Shortfall
 VaR calculations
 Expected shortfall
 Coherent risk measures
 Risk control for expected utility--maximizing investors
 Economic capital
 Extreme Value Theory
2. Reduced form models of defaults: Hazard rates
2.1 Implied probability of defaults and credit yield curves
 Credit yield curves
 Credit spread and default intensities
2.2 Exponential models of joint defaults
 Joint survival of two obligors
 Multi--obligor extension
 Simulation algorithm
2.3 Credit derivatives
 Credit default swaps
 Synthetic Collateralized Debts Obligations
2.4 Hazard rates and credit derivatives pricing
 Implied hazard rate and calibration
 Building blocks of credit derivatives pricing
2.5 Counterparty risks
 Nature of counterparty risk
 Credit value adjustment
3. Default correlation models
3.1 Mixture models for modeling default correlation
 Bernoulli mixture models
 Fractional losses and correlation of defaults
3.2 CreditRisk+
 Mixture Poisson distribution
 Independent sector risk factors
 General sector analysis
3.3 CreditMetrics and Gaussian copula models
 Credit migration of firm credit indexes
 Gaussian copula models
 Monte Carlo simulation
reviews.comment_teaching:
開學就叫廢嘅學生請自動drop科。睇唔起學生，成日踩人唔識嘢。有人問簡單問題就話太簡單唔答浪費時間，最後幾乎冇人再問佢問題。

新冠肺炎期間經常咳。上堂唔戴口罩全世界怕咗佢唔敢返去。

notes好多錯，教幾十年都唔改；唔單單係語法錯，係直接formula都錯：例如ES個integral冇咗conditional probability；EC幅圖錯足幾十年；concept notation亂到癲，一個概念notation可以有三四套簡單複雜化經典代表。PGF咁簡單嘅概念，佢足足用咗五六套notations去表達同一樣嘢搞到我都唔識，更加唔好講冇讀過進階probability theory嘅RMBI同學。

bernoulli都唔識串，成個topic一百頁全部bernoulli串錯字。啲notes手寫字細到阿媽唔認得，字又靚到葉劉淑儀噉。

MAFM銷售agent，年頭講到年尾一路吹MAFM幾勁幾勁、叫人讀個二十幾萬Msc學位。一睇畢業去向，幾乎全部入嗮中資同big4，唔去八卦真係以爲個個入嗮jane street，citadel，virtu添。

話冇乜香港學生讀MAFM點點點，不如檢討點解冇香港學生願意跟佢讀。

優秀嘅教授定義係會用最簡單嘅方法教識最差嘅學生最難嘅嘢；而佢係用最難以理解嘅方法教唔識學生最簡單嘅嘢。勸告MATH/MAEC同學如非必要就無謂入嚟受難，RMBI同學就唯有硬食，加油。

----------------------------------------------------------
臨grad想同真係考慮MAFM嘅學生講幾句。佢話上年收百幾個學生，得幾個係香港，其他清一色都係大陸學生。所以如果讀MAFM，你要再次面對佢嘅低質教學、難以融入program羣體、一年青春+二十幾萬港紙機會成本。而MAFM畢業人工median都得兩萬幾月入。

reviews.comment_content: Pretty specific and in-depth contents on advanced probability theories, with applications in financial problems
reviews.comment_teaching: He's cute, meticulous. Would go through all steps of proofs and examples in lectures
reviews.comment_workload:
4 homework sets in total, including math problems (calculation and proof), excel, R problems, and finance problems. Some of them are very tedious, and quite challenging, but mostly highly related to the course materials.

Midterm is quite manageable, many of the problems were drawn (or variations of those) from homework/practice. Final is quite challenging, with a mean of 50 out of 100.

reviews.comment_teaching:
To be honest, I don't really like his teaching. His teaching pace is not suitable for me. Maybe I cannot get his kind of humour.

I find it hard to catch up with his lecture after midterm especially when I didn't pay full attention in a few lectures during midterm period.

The notations in his lecture notes is a bit messy, he used a few notations to denote the same thing and it will be very difficult for you to understand the materials if you didn't pay attention in his lectures

It takes time to digest the materials in this course. So, even this course just have Midterm and Final, I spent quite some time to study this course.

There is a problem set given by the professor and the TA will go through it in the tutorials. However, I would say doing the proble set is not necessary as it is much harder then what you will see in the exams.

reviews.author: 數學研究生
reviews.title: Great Subject
reviews.comment_content:
It introduces Bonds, duration and convexity. Contents include bond immunization, horizon rates and interest rates.

Topics on CDS and CDO, pricing on defaultable bonds by risk-free bonds and survival probabilities. Contents include Pricing CDS, credit spread, default rates and intensity. Stories about CDO.

Options: Delta Hedging and Black Scholes Model, VaR and Expected Shortfall and Extreme Value Theorem.

Last topics are modeling, still learning, not familiar with it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Kwok is one of my favorite professors in Math Department. He talks a lot interesting stories about the content. He has a huge deep knowledge on Credit Derivatives and Stochastic Modeling.

As he teaches master program, he tells us something related to master level. He uses his lecture notes and talks humorously in class.

He likes asking questions in class so you'd better pay attention in class and please don't talk or use mobile phones in class. He does not like students do not pay attention in class.

I don't know is it a good news or bad news, I know he is going to reduce the lecture materials starting in next semester. i.e. Some students think the continuous part may be difficult to understand and some content may be too difficult, Professor is going to cut syllabus.
